p: In the present studies, we used OBP and fluorescently labeled OriS DNA fragments. Prior to experiment, the HSV1 UL9 gene (strain L 2 from the State Virus Collection of D.I. Ivanovsky Institute of Virology) was amplified by PCR, inserted into plasmid pET14 and expressed in E. coli cells. The recombinant UL9 protein forms specific complexes with Boxes I and II in OriS and is endowed with helicase and ATPase activities ( Bazhulina et al., 2012; Surovaya et al., 2010).
